definition: Lin Zexu or Lin Tse-hsu "Commissioner Lin" (1785-1850), Qing official whose anti-opium activities led to first Opium war with Britain 1840-1842
surname Lin/Japanese surname Hayashi
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
slowly/gently
surname Xu

sentences.english: Lin Zexu (Lin Tse-hsu ) was a Chinese scholar and official during the Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 林则徐是清朝的学者和官员。

sentences.english: I mean I was startled by Lin Zexu's exploits.
sentences.chinese: 我是说我被林则徐修渠的壮举给吓了一跳。

sentences.english: This picture reminds me of one of our national heroes, Lin Zexu.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画让我想到了我们的一个民族英雄，林则徐。

sentences.english: Which was the one built by Lin Zexu?
sentences.chinese: 哪条是林则徐修建的呢？

sentences.english: Lin Zexu was one of the greatest minds of that age.
sentences.chinese: 林则徐是那个时代最有头脑的人物之一。

sentences.english: Is also say, Manchu Court to wood then slowly of the memorial haven't made a reaction.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，清廷对林则徐的奏折尚未作出反应。

sentences.english: Lin Zexu was a great hero in the history.
sentences.chinese: 林则徐是历史上一位伟大的英雄人物。

sentences.english: The great national hero, Lin Zexu.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的民族英雄林则徐。

sentences.english: Reportedly , the Dongshan District in Dashatou Harbour Plaza Lin Zexu erected statues.
sentences.chinese: 据悉，东山区计划在大沙头港湾广场竖立林则徐雕像。

definition: Zuo Zongtang (1812-1885), Chinese administrator and military leader
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Shen Baozhen (1820-1879), Qing Minister of the Navy, founded Fuzhou Naval College 船政學堂|船政学堂[Chuan2 zheng4 Xue2 tang2] in 1866
Xu Jiyu (1795-1873), Chinese geographer
Governor of Guangdong and Guangxi
Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
Zeng Guofan (1811-1872), Qing dynasty politician and military man
the Qing court (as government of China)
Daoguang Emperor
Cang Jize or Tseng Chi-tse (1839-1890), pioneer diplomat of late Qing, serve as imperial commissioner (ambassador) to UK, France and Russia
Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Sino-French War (1883-1885) (concerning French seizure of Vietnam)
Qing government (1644-1911)
Wei Yuan (1794-1857), Qing dynasty thinker, historian and scholar
Tan Sitong (1865-1898), Qing writer and politician, one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子 of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898
Xue Fucheng (1838-1894), Qing official and progressive political theorist
